text: When the DataFormatter formats a date, it sometimes does not display the value from the view in Excel. Daylight Saving Time started on March 31st 2013. In Excel it displays 31.03.2013 02:00:00, while the DataFormatter formats it to 31.03.2013 03:00:00. After that, the date is displayed as in the view (for example 31.03.2013 04:00:00).
creator: j_handrick@hotmail.de

text:
Created attachment 30243
unit test

Unit test showing different DataFormatter formattings
creator: j_handrick@hotmail.de

text: DataFormatter largely relies on the underlying Java Date Formatter classes, which in turn will depend on the system timezone. Could it be that your system isn't in the same timezone you expect?
creator: apache@gagravarr.org

text: FYI I've just tried your unit test on a machine set to a UK locale + timezone, and it passes just fine
creator: apache@gagravarr.org
dominik.stadler@gmx.at
text:
Based on the comments from Nick I am closing this as WORKSFORME, especially as we did not get any response on the questions.

For 3.13 we are working on some more support for different Timezones, but overall it should be possible to the set the Timezone for the JavaVM that executes the code to whatever value you would like to see begin applied.
